result.execSummary:
The defendant Deodis C Stanley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Completion of Representation
Defendant's signed acknowledgement of the Court's 9/26/17 Order
Bond payment information

The Court Orders that: Upon deposit of $100.00 and current address information the Defendant be released from custody on the above mentioned case(s).  The Defendant shall pay the remaining balance plus interest and $15.00 payment plan fee at the rate of $25.00/month commencing 10/31/2017.  25% annual increase of monthly payments shall be implemented.  Civil judgment and referral to the WI DOR if applicable shall remain.  Any failure to comply with this payment order shall result it the re-imposition of the failure to pay sentence without further notice of hearing. Endorsed by the Court on 09/25/2017.

[MK] cases #16CM165, #16CM473, #17CM24, #17CM25 called at 9:49am.
Defendant Deodis C Stanley in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest " entered in Case #16CM165 and in Case #16CM473; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Cases #17CM24 & #17CM25; further the Court reads in an uncharged referral (DA Case #16JE3039) for Violation of Injunction with a date of violation of 11/20/2016, and thereafter bars further prosecution of this referral.

In Case #16CM165 the Court sentences Mr. Stanley to:
--serve 120 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith, concurrent with Case #16CM473 but consecutive to any other sentence 
--the Court authorizes the transfer of the service of this jail term to the Rock County Jail conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring 
--73 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 within 60 days;  non-payment shall result in a 30 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
The Court orders DNA sample provision.


In Case #16CM473 the Court sentences Mr. Stanley to:
--serve 120 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith, concurrent with Case #16CM165 but consecutive to any other sentence 
--the Court authorizes the transfer of the service of this jail term to the Rock County Jail conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring 
--73 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 within 60 days; non-payment shall result in a 30 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
The Court orders DNA sample provision.
recess 9:59am
Routed to JA for further review. (5/8/17 /hb )

This Amended Bond applies to Cases #16CM165, #16CM473, #17CM24, #17CM25.
Conditions of this Amended Bond include:  
--to comply with any Injunction that Mr. Stanley is the subject of
--even if the Injunction as to Leslie McClaren were to dropped, Mr. Stanley is not to have any contact with Leslie McLaren. (*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.)

[MK] cases #16CM165, #16CM473, #17CM24, #17CM25 called at 10:52am. 
Defendant Deodis C Stanley in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled on Mr. Stanley's 4/20/17 letter requesting bond reduction. 
Arguments given by counsel. 
The Court grants the request to reduce the bond amount. The Court amends the Bond, requiring a $250 Cash Bond (applies to all cases) with the same conditions as previously ordered. 
recess 11:00am

[MK] cases #16CM165 #16CM473 #17CM24 and #17CM25 called at 3:46pm. 
Defendant Deodis C Stanley in court, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court determines that the Warrants in these cases have been executed and satisfied through Mr. Stanley's appearance; the Warrants are to be removed from any databases that they have been entered into. 

Initial Appearances held in cases 16CM473 17CM24 and 17CM25:
Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaints is correct.  Mr. Stanley provides the new address of:  1324 E. Racine Street, Janesville WI 53545. 
Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaints 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Pleas of "not guilty" entered on all three cases. 
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearances.  

The Court requires a $500 Cash Bond to apply to all four cases, with the conditions:
--to comply with any Injunction that Mr. Stanley is the subject of
--even if the Injunction as to Leslie McClaren were to dropped, Mr. Stanley is not to have any contact with Leslie McLaren.  
recess 4:00pm. 


NEXT:   Status Conference in Case #16CM165, and Adjourned Initial Appearances in Cases #16CM473, #17CM24 and #17CM25--all on April 4th at 3:00pm in Branch II

[MK] case called at 9:43am. 
Attorney Michael Yang in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Yang indicates that he does not have any information regarding the non-appearance of Defendant Deodis Stanley. 
The Court notes that mailings of the Notice of today's hearing were returned by the Postal Service, however Mr. Stanley was given a handwritten Scheduling Notice in court that lists today's date and time
The Court issues a Bench Warrant for the arrest of Mr. Stanley-- to include a provision that Mr. Stanley may be released upon posting of $500 Cash Bail as long as he is given a new court date and time to appear.  
The Court finds the Signature Bond to be in default and orders the Bond forfeited. 
recess 9:45am.
